Decentralized, blockchain-enabled, cryptographically secure, general-purpose

Digital Dead Man's Switch

Dead man's switch - wikipedia.org > wiki > Dead_man's_switch

A dead man's switch is a switch designed to be activated or deactivated if the human operator becomes incapacitated, such as through death, loss of consciousness, or being bodily removed from control

For Developers, By Developers

Sarcophagus is decentralized, open-source and DAO owned + operated. We believe bringing dead man's switch funcationality to the web3 ecosystem can empower and provide security infrastructure for an entire generation of applications, regaurdless of their size. We believe everyone, including individuals, should have the right to affordable, accessable, immutable secret storage and recovery.

View Litepaper

Governance

Documentation

Dev Chat

Long-Term Storage and Recovery

Sarcophagus is designed to allow recovery at custom intervals, when the payload is available for decryption based on a lack of response from the creator. A more complete backup system than traditional recovery mechanisms.

Use Case Potential:

emergency communications

whistleblowers

digital inheritance

crypto key management

credential passdown

emergency communications

whistleblowers

digital inheritance

crypto key management

credential passdown

There are nearly unlimited use cases for Sarcophagus. It is useful in any situation where a user may want to release information in the event of their removal from control.

Partners and Supporters

Sarcophagus is a 100% open-source project using the Unlicense. It has been built by a global team of software developers, crypto enthusiasts and security experts. It has not yet been audited; use at your own risk.
